item.title: Alphabet 正在洽谈以 330 亿美元收购云安全公司 Wiz
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Alphabet 公司正在洽谈以 330 亿美元的价格收购云安全公司 Wiz，重启去年夏天经过长时间谈判后被叫停的交易讨论。【原文：Alphabet Inc. is in talks to purchase the cloud security company Wiz for $33 billion, restarting deal discussions that were called off last summer after extended negotiations, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: WeightWatchers 与贷款人开始私下协商解决债务问题
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，WW 国际公司的一些贷款人已与这家饮食公司进行了秘密会谈，因为该公司正努力削减利息支出，同时收入持续下降。【原文：Some lenders to WW International Inc. have entered into confidential talks with the diet company as it tries to cut interest expenses while revenue declines persist, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 卡尼称加拿大对美国进一步加征关税的回应有限
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，鉴于两国经济规模的不匹配，加拿大在应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收的新税方面只能做到这一步。【原文：Canada can only go so far in responding to new levies imposed by US President Donald Trump given the mismatch in size between the economies, Prime Minister Mark Carney said.】

item.title: 与主要股东达成协议后，JBS 距离美国上市更近了一步
item.description: 在与第二大股东达成协议后，巴西 JBS SA 公司正向期待已久的股票在纽约上市迈进。【原文：Brazil’s JBS SA is moving closer to a long-awaited share listing in New York after a deal with its second-biggest shareholder.】

item.title: 对全球前景的担忧加剧，日本央行将维持利率不变
item.description: 由于贸易紧张局势升级导致对全球经济前景的担忧加剧，预计日本央行本周将维持基准利率不变。【原文：The Bank of Japan is expected to keep its benchmark interest rate unchanged this week as concerns over global economic prospects mount due to escalating trade tensions.】

item.title: 亿万富豪郑氏家族与路易威登洽谈香港大型专卖店事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁郑氏家族控制的香港房地产公司新世界发展有限公司正在与奢侈品巨头路易威登洽谈在该开发商的一个标志性购物中心开设一家大型专卖店的事宜。【原文：New World Development Co., the Hong Kong real estate company controlled by the billionaire Cheng family, is in talks with luxury giant Louis Vuitton to open a mega store in one of the developer’s signature malls, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大最古老的公司哈德逊湾试图避免全面清算
item.description: 哈德逊湾公司（Hudson's Bay Co.【原文：Hudson’s Bay Co. fought to avoid a full shutdown in a Toronto courtroom on Monday, asking for permission to begin liquidating most of its stores this week.】

item.title: 德国最高法院驳回更多阻止债务制动投票的企图
item.description: 德国最高法院驳回了其他试图阻止即将卸任的议会修改宪法以取消国防借款限制和建立 5000 亿欧元（5460 亿美元）基础设施基金的企图。【原文：Germany’s top court rejected additional attempts to prevent the nation’s outgoing parliament from making changes to the constitution to remove limits on defense borrowing and set up a €500 billion ($546 billion) infrastructure fund.】

item.title: 特朗普任命米歇尔-鲍曼为美联储银行高级官员
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统挑选美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）担任央行负责监管事务的副主席，此举受到华尔街银行和小型贷款机构的欢呼，他们希望米歇尔-鲍曼对该行业更加友好。【原文：President Donald Trump picked Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman to serve as the central bank’s vice chair for supervision, a move cheered by Wall Street banks and smaller lenders who expect she’ll be friendlier to the industry.】

item.title: S&P 将 Vista 支持的 Solera 信用评级进一步降至垃圾级
item.description: S&P Global Ratings 将 Solera 的信用等级进一步下调为垃圾级，因为这家由 Vista Equity Partners 支持的软件公司正面临高债务负担和负现金流的困境。【原文：S&P Global Ratings cut its credit grade on Solera further into junk, as the Vista Equity Partners-backed software company struggles with a high debt load and negative cash flow.】

item.title: 新西兰总理在与印度的贸易协议中并未放弃乳制品
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克松（Christopher Luxon）表示，新西兰已准备好与印度进行一些艰难的谈判，以寻求达成包括乳制品在内的自由贸易协定。【原文：New Zealand is ready for some tough negotiations with India as it seeks a free-trade agreement that includes dairy, Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said.】

item.title: Reddit 被评为 "出售"，因为 Redburn 标志着来自谷歌算法的风险
item.description: 据分析师称，Reddit 公司经历的用户增长是 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌的 "礼物"，可能导致了对这家社交媒体公司的过度看好，而谷歌则成为了该股最大的看空者。【原文：The user growth experienced by Reddit Inc. is a “gift” from Alphabet Inc.’s Google that may have led to excessive bullishness on the social-media company, according to analysts who have become the stock’s biggest bear.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，Alphabet 正洽谈以 300 亿美元收购初创公司 Wiz
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》援引知情人士的话报道，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 公司正再次洽谈收购网络安全初创公司 Wiz —；这一次，收购价格约为 300 亿美元。【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. is in talks once again to buy the cybersecurity startup Wiz — this time, for around $30 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴西着手提高汽油中的乙醇含量
item.description: 世界第二大乙醇生产国巴西将提高汽油中生物燃料的混合比例，此举将在供应量激增的情况下为当地工业提供帮助。【原文：The world’s second-largest producer of ethanol Brazil is set to increase the blend of biofuel in gasoline, in a move to aid local industry as supply booms.】

item.title: 喷气机制造商庞巴迪警告加拿大F-35审查可能适得其反
item.description: 加拿大喷气式飞机制造商庞巴迪公司（Bombardier Inc.【原文：The head of Canadian jet manufacturer Bombardier Inc. raised concerns about Canada’s decision to review a contract to buy dozens of F-35 fighter jets from Lockheed Martin Corp., the country’s latest response to the trade war with the US.】

item.title: 激光雷达技术试驾视频广为流传后，Luminar 公司股价飙升
item.description: 前美国国家航空航天局（NASA）科学家马克-罗伯（Mark Rober）在YouTube视频中试驾了一辆配备该公司激光雷达技术的汽车，并称其性能优于特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Luminar Technologies Inc. shares surged on Monday after former NASA scientist Mark Rober test-drove a car equipped with the company’s lidar technology in a YouTube video and said it outperformed Tesla Inc.’s Autopilot feature.】

item.title: 富兰克林邓普顿因降息谨慎而减持澳元债券
item.description: 富兰克林邓普顿削减了其在澳大利亚的债券持有量，因为该公司预计该国的降息幅度低于市场预期。【原文：Franklin Templeton has trimmed its Australian bond holdings as it anticipates shallower interest-rate cuts in the nation compared with market estimates.】

item.title: 中国延长美国肉类加工厂注册期限，提升出口希望
item.description: 中国政府为一些资格即将失效的美国肉类加工厂重新办理了出口登记，这为肉类运输不会中断带来了希望。【原文：China’s government has renewed export registrations for some US meat plants whose eligibility was set to lapse, raising hopes that shipments won’t be disrupted.】

item.title: 与兴登堡有关的莫斐斯研究机构发布首份简短报告
item.description: Morpheus Research 是一家新成立的做空公司，其成员包括 Hindenburg Research 的校友，该公司周一发布了第一份报告。【原文：Morpheus Research, a new short-selling firm that includes alumni of Hindenburg Research, published its first report Monday.】

item.title: 美国人发现贷款被拒的风险越来越大
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的数据显示，越来越多的美国消费者表示，他们不寻求贷款是因为他们预计在信贷紧缩的情况下会被拒绝。【原文：A growing share of US consumers say they’re not seeking loans because they expect to be refused amid tight credit conditions, according to data from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 宝马出售 40 亿美元债券，发行人提前完成交易
item.description: 宝马汽车公司正在出售 40 亿美元的美国高等级债券，因为在美联储周三做出利率决定之前，投资级企业会抓住市场相对平静的机会筹集新的债务。【原文：BMW AG is selling $4 billion of US high-grade bonds as investment-grade firms seize on the relative market calm to raise fresh debt ahead of the Federal Reserve rate decision Wednesday.】

item.title: 大西洋两岸都在进行垃圾贷款交易
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战引发经济不确定性之后，欧洲和美国的公司都在搁置开发贷款市场中风险最高一角的计划。【原文：Companies in both Europe and the US are shelving plans to tap the riskiest corner of the loan market after US President Donald Trump’s trade wars triggered economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 德国各党首脑在投票前看到了对财政方案的支持
item.description: 周二，在保守派和社会民主党议员对支出法案表示压倒性支持后，德国举债建设国防和基础设施的计划仍有望获得议会批准。【原文：German plans for a debt-financed splurge on defense and infrastructure remained on track for parliamentary approval on Tuesday after conservative and Social Democrat lawmakers signaled overwhelming support for the spending bill.】

item.title: 联邦通信委员会和参议院情报部门负责人希望说服欧洲放弃华为
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会主席和参议院情报委员会主席正联手劝说欧洲电信公司停止与中国设备制造商华为技术有限公司（Huawei Technologies Co.【原文：The head of the Federal Communications Commission and the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee are teaming up to persuade European telecom companies to stop doing business with Chinese equipment-maker Huawei Technologies Co.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易首脑在艰难推出关税后力促秩序井然
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的最高贸易谈判代表正试图为预计下月实施的全面新关税注入秩序，而此前宣布的新关税措施曾扰乱市场并加剧了商业的不确定性。【原文：President Donald Trump’s top trade negotiator is attempting to inject order into sweeping new tariffs expected next month, after previous announcements roiled markets and fueled business uncertainty.】

item.title: VR Capital 和 Fidera 加入 Ashmore 委内瑞拉债券持有人小组
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，VR Capital Group 和 Fidera Ltd 正在加入委内瑞拉债权人委员会，从而使该集团控制的金额达到委内瑞拉 600 亿美元违约美元债券的一半左右。【原文：VR Capital Group and Fidera Ltd are joining a Venezuela creditor committee, bringing the amount the group controls to roughly half of the nation’s $60 billion of defaulted dollar bonds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 基金押注布伦特原油将涨至 100 美元，因为风险溢价在增加
item.description: 在中东紧张局势重燃的背景下，一家基金正以低廉的价格押注布伦特原油将向每桶 100 美元攀升，而整个行业的悲观情绪使得华尔街的银行纷纷下调价格预期。【原文：One fund is taking on a cheap long-shot bet that Brent crude will climb toward $100 a barrel amid revived tensions in the Middle East, even as industrywide pessimism saw banks across Wall Street revising price forecasts lower.】

item.title: First Trust 终止与 TCW 的 80 亿美元 ETF 合作关系
item.description: 美国最大的 ETF 发行商之一 First Trust 终止了 TCW Group Inc.【原文：First Trust, one of the largest issuers of US ETFs, terminated TCW Group Inc. as the manager of four exchange-traded funds valued at about $8 billion.】

item.title: 尽管供应紧张，埃及仍恢复向出口工厂输送天然气
item.description: 在埃及不得不转向进口天然气以满足国内需求之后，埃及的两个液化天然气出口设施恢复了天然气供应。【原文：Gas flows to Egypt’s two LNG exports facilities have resumed in an unusual move after the country had to turn to imports to meet domestic demand.】

item.title: 美国回购利率面临的国债供应压力已达极限
item.description: 国库券供应量的减少给美国政府证券的融资利率带来了下行压力，但摩根大通银行的利率策略师表示，这一趋势可能已经达到极限。【原文：The shrinking supply of Treasury bills is putting downward pressure on financing rates for US government securities, but interest-rate strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. say the trend may be reaching its limit.】
